description: This notification indicates that the current size of
Diagnostic Log grows beyond
docsDiagLogNotifyLogSizeHighThrshld.

event.Summary: Diagnostic Log size surpassed the max threshold {$v4}

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DOCS-DIAG-MIB::docsDiagLogSizeHighThrshldReached DOCS-CABLE-DEVICE-MIB::docsDevEvLevel i 1 DOCS-CABLE-DEVICE-MIB::docsDevEvId u 9999 DOCS-DIAG-MIB::docsDiagLogIncludeTriggers b 0 DOCS-DIAG-MIB::docsDiagLogMaxSize u 1

description: The priority level of this event, as defined by the
vendor. These are ordered from most serious (emergency)
to least serious (debug).
emergency(1) events indicate vendor-specific fatal
hardware or software errors that prevent normal system
operation.
alert(2) events indicate a serious failure that causes
the reporting system to reboot but that is not caused by
hardware or software malfunctioning.
critical(3) events indicate a serious failure that
requires attention and prevents the device from
transmitting data but that could be recovered without
rebooting the system.
error(4) and warning(5) events indicate that a failure
occurred that could interrupt the normal data flow but
that does not cause the device to re-register.
notice(6) and information(7) events indicate a
milestone or checkpoint in normal operation that could
be of particular importance for troubleshooting.
debug(8) events are reserved for vendor-specific
events.
During normal operation, no event more
critical than notice(6) should be generated. Events
between warning and emergency should be generated at
appropriate levels of problems (e.g., emergency when the
box is about to crash).
variables.name: DOCS-CABLE-DEVICE-MIB::docsDevEvLevel

description: For this product, uniquely identifies the type of event
that is reported by this entry.
variables.name: DOCS-CABLE-DEVICE-MIB::docsDevEvId

description: Turns individual diagnostic triggers on and off.
Multiple triggers can be turned on or off at a given time.
Setting a particular bit to '1' turns on corresponding
diagnostic trigger. Setting a particular bit to '0' turns
off corresponding diagnostic trigger.
variables.name: DOCS-DIAG-MIB::docsDiagLogIncludeTriggers

description: The maximum number of Cable Modem entries that
docsDiagLogTable can report.
variables.name: DOCS-DIAG-MIB::docsDiagLogMaxSize

description: This notification indicates that the current size of
Diagnostic Log drops to docsDiagLogNotifyLogSizeLowThrshld
after it exceeded docsDiagLogNotifyLogSizeHighThrshld
earlier.

event.Summary: Diagnostic Log size is below the threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DOCS-DIAG-MIB::docsDiagLogSizeLowThrshldReached DOCS-CABLE-DEVICE-MIB::docsDevEvLevel i 1 DOCS-CABLE-DEVICE-MIB::docsDevEvId u 9999 DOCS-DIAG-MIB::docsDiagLogIncludeTriggers b 0 DOCS-DIAG-MIB::docsDiagLogMaxSize u 1

description: This notification indicates that the Diagnostic Log is
full.
